Package ohos.utils.net

Class Uri.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.net.Uri.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Uri

    public static final class Uri.Builder
extends Object
    Quickly constructs a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) object.

    The standard URI format is as follows:

    [scheme:]scheme-specific-part[#fragment]

    An opaque URI must be an absolute URI, and its scheme-specific-part field cannot start with a slash (/). An opaque URI does not need to be parsed.

    A hierarchical URI can be an absolute URI, but its scheme-specific-part field must start with a slash (/). It can also be a relative URI. The standard format of a hierarchical URI is as follows:

    [scheme:][//authority][path][?query][#fragment]

    If the URI is of the server type, its authority field can be parsed in the following format:

    [user-info@]host[:port]

    Since:
    1

      Uri.Builder appendDecodedPath​(String path)

      Appends the encoded path to the existing path in the current hierarchical URI.
      Uri build​()
      Creates a Uri instance based on the current Builder object.
      Uri.Builder clearQuery​()
      Clears the query field of the current hierarchical URI.
      Uri.Builder decodedAuthority​(String authority)
      Sets all characters of the authority field in the current hierarchical URI to be encoded, including the at signs (@) and colons (:).
      Uri.Builder decodedFragment​(String fragment)
      Sets all characters of the fragment field in the current URI to be encoded.
      Uri.Builder decodedOpaqueSsp​(String opaqueSsp)
      Sets the scheme-specific-part field in the current opaque URI to be encoded but not to be parsed.

      Sets the characters other than slashes (/) of the path field in the current hierarchical URI to be encoded.
      Uri.Builder decodedQuery​(String query)
      Sets all characters of the query field in the current hierarchical URI to be encoded, including the question marks (?) and equal signs (=).

      Sets the authority field of the current hierarchical URI.

      Sets the query field of the current hierarchical URI.

      Sets the scheme field of the current URI.

      Obtains the string representation of Uri that is created via Builder.

      • appendDecodedPath

        public Uri.Builder appendDecodedPath​(String path)
        Appends the decoded path to the existing path in the current hierarchical URI.

        If the path field in the URI has not been set, this added path will be processed as an absolute path.

        Parameters:
        path - Indicates the decoded path to append to the hierarchical URI. The path must not start with a slash (/).
        Returns:
        Returns the Builder object.

      • appendEncodedPath

        public Uri.Builder appendEncodedPath​(String path)
        Appends the encoded path to the existing path in the current hierarchical URI.

        If the path field in the URI has not been set, this added path will be processed as an absolute path.

        Parameters:
        path - Indicates the encoded path to append to the hierarchical URI. The path must not start with a slash (/).
        Returns:
        Returns the Builder object.

      • build

        public Uri build​()
        Creates a Uri instance based on the current Builder object.
        Returns:
        Returns an opaque URI if the opaqueSsp parameter has been set; returns a hierarchical URI otherwise.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the opaqueSsp is not null but scheme is null.
